title: Relationship in CO2 and Temp Data

content.question: Which of the following best describes the relationship between the variables shown in the graphs?

choices.label: <math overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mstyle mathvariant="normal"> <mrow> <mi>C</mi> <msub> <mrow> <mi>O</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> concentrations and Antarctic temperatures have steadily decreased from <math alttext="800,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>800</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> years ago, and present-day values for both variables are the lowest they have been in <math alttext="800,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>800</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> years.

<math overflow="scroll"> <mstyle mathvariant="normal"> <mrow> <mi>C</mi> <msub> <mrow> <mi>O</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> concentrations and Antarctic temperatures have steadily increased from <math alttext="800,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>800</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> years ago, and the present-day value for <math overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mstyle mathvariant="normal"> <mrow> <mi>C</mi> <msub> <mrow> <mi>O</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> concentration is the lowest it has been in <math alttext="800,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>800</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> years.

<math overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mstyle mathvariant="normal"> <mrow> <mi>C</mi> <msub> <mrow> <mi>O</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> concentrations and Antarctic temperatures have cycled approximately every <math alttext="50,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> years, and the present-day value for <math overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mstyle mathvariant="normal"> <mrow> <mi>C</mi> <msub> <mrow> <mi>O</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> concentration is the highest it has been in <math alttext="800,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>800</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> years.

<math overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mstyle mathvariant="normal"> <mrow> <mi>C</mi> <msub> <mrow> <mi>O</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> concentrations and Antarctic temperatures have cycled approximately every <math alttext="50,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> years, and present-day values for both variables are the highest they have been in <math alttext="800,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>800</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> years.

content.answer: <math overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mstyle mathvariant="normal"> <mrow> <mi>C</mi> <msub> <mrow> <mi>O</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> concentrations and Antarctic temperatures have cycled approximately every <math alttext="50,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> years, and the present-day value for <math overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mstyle mathvariant="normal"> <mrow> <mi>C</mi> <msub> <mrow> <mi>O</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> concentration is the highest it has been in <math alttext="800,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>800</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> years.

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Describe patterns or trends in data.
